* Duke class is run as a program via main() method
* Our main method. This xecutes the Duke program.
* Constructor for Deadline. This handles user input.
* @param input Raw input from the user.
* Constructor for Deadline. This is used when reading duke.txt file.
* @param description Description of the task activity.
* @param by Time by which this task must be completed.
* Getter for "by" in a formatted String.
* @return Formatted String that nicely displays LocalDate by into "MMM d yyyy".
* @return Displays the task as [D], as well as "by".
* This class extends InvalidCommandException. It handles cases when users do not
* specify activity description of the task they wish to add.
* @param message The message will be either deadline, event, or todo.
super(String.format("The description of a %s cannot be empty.", message));
* Constructor for Event. This handles user input.
* @param input Raw input from the user.
* Constructor for Event. This is used when reading duke.txt file.
* @param description Description of the task activity.
* @param at Time at which this task will take place.
* Getter for "at" in a formatted String.
* @return Formatted String that nicely displays LocalDate by into "MMM d yyyy".
* @return Displays the task as [E], as well as "at".
* This class handles all exceptions arising within Duke program.
* @param message The message will be formatted as shown below.
* This class parses the user input into a command understood by Duke.
* Constructor for Parser class. Initializes Storage and TaskList classes.
* @param filePath file URL where task information will be stored.
* This method returns the first word of raw user input.
* @return The first word which is the command for Duke to understand.
* Method that allows Duke to handle the query by the user.
* Error controls to tackle EmptyDescriptionError and UnknownCommandError.
* Command parsed by parse() method will be used to identify the query type.
* "bye" command will store taskList as a duke.txt file, then return null
* which is picked up by the Ui class to shut down the window.
* @param command used to classify the query type from the user.
* @param input contains the overall user input.
private String handleQuery(String command, String input) {
* This method will show users that the task has been added successfully to taskList.
* @param size The current size of taskList.
public String add(Task t, int size) {
return "     Got it. I've added this task: \n"
+ String.format("     Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n", size);
* This method will show users that the task has been successfully marked as completed.
* @param t The taks that is marked as completed.
return "     Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n"
* This method will show users that the task has been deleted successfully from the taskList.
* @param size The current size of the taskList.
public String delete(Task t, int size) {
return "     Noted. I've removed this task: \n"
+ String.format("     Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n", size);
* This class will be responsible for loading and storing the taskList.
* @param filePath User must specify where they wish their file be created.
* This method loads the currently existing taskList memory to Duke. If the file
* does not exist, then it will be created.
* @return Returns the taskList for the TaskList class to be initialized.
* @throws IOException Error control for potential IOException.
// if the directory "data" does not exist, then create the directory
// check if "duke.txt" exists. If yes, load the info to taskList. Else, create the file.
* This method stores the current taskList from Duke to the device.
* @throws IOException Error control for potential IOException.
public void store(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* This class represents each task registered by the user.
* @param description Description of the task activity.
* Method to represent the task status.
* @return Returns X for completed, and blank for non-completed task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Setter to mark a task as completed.
* toString method to represent Task into a String.
* @return Shows both the status and the description of the activity.
* This class manages all requests made to the taskList.
* @param tasks Stores the taskList memory as an ArrayList.
* Method to add a task to the taskList.
* Method to delete a task from the taskList.
* @param index Index of the task to remove from the taskList.
* Method to mark a task as completed from the taskList.
* @param index Index of the task to select from the taskList.
* @return The task being marked as completed.
* Method to list the currently existing tasks.
* @return The String form that will be passed to Ui to be shown to the user.
StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder("     Here are the tasks in your list:\n");
* Method to return the size of the current taskList.
* @return The size of the current taskList.
StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder("     Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");

* This method will wrap any message within a formatted box.
* @param content The message to be shown to the user.
* This class extends InvalidCommandException. It handles cases when users do not
* give a command that is understood by Duke.
* @param message This message will be discarded.
